metadata.dc:author: Ibañez, L
De la Fuente, H
Guzmán, S
Llanos, O
Ross, M
metadata.dc:description: A 55 year old man presented with vomiting, abdominal pain, diarrhea, jaundice and choluria. An obstruction of the gastric outlet by a large gallstone located at the duodenum was demonstrated by radiologic, ultrasonographic and endoscopic examinations. The stone could not be removed through endoscopy and the patient was successfully operated on. A review of published reports is included.
metadata.dc:title: Obstrucción duodenal por cálculo biliar (sindrome de Bouveret): caso clínico.
[Duodenal obstruction caused by cholelithiasis (Bouverets' syndrome): a clinical case].
